com.samysadi.acs.service.vmplacement

Interface VmPlacementPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VmPlacementPolicyAbstract, VmPlacementPolicyBestFit, VmPlacementPolicyFirstFit, VmPlacementPolicyRandomFit, VmPlacementPolicyWorstFit

    public interface VmPlacementPolicy
extends Entity
    Defines methods for selecting a host among all available hosts when placing a Virtual Machine.

    This interface also define a method for placing a VM after a host has been selected, and a method to unplace it after it has been placed (see each method documentation for more information).

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

      • clone

        VmPlacementPolicy clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity

      • selectHost

        Host selectHost(VirtualMachine vm,
              List<Host> hosts,
              List<Host> excludedHosts)
        Selects a host where to place the given vm and returns it.

        A host among all given hosts will be selected such that it satisfies the virtual machine's defined SLA (defined through its configuration).
        Among other conditions, the selected host must be in FailureProneEntity.FailureState.OK state. But, it can be in a state other than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON if the cloud provider's power manager allows it to be powered on. In which case, it is left to the placement method to power it on.

        Depending on whether a host was found or not, a NotificationCodes.VMPLACEMENT_VMSELECTION_SUCCESS or NotificationCodes.VMPLACEMENT_VMSELECTION_FAILED is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vm -
        hosts - possible hosts. May be null in which case, all hosts in the cloud are considered.
        excludedHosts - a list of hosts that should not be selected. May be null.
        Returns:
        the selected host or null if no host was found

      • selectHost

        Host selectHost(VirtualMachine vm,
              List<Host> hosts)
        Alias for selectHost(VirtualMachine, List, List) where excluded hosts is null.

      • selectHost

        Host selectHost(VirtualMachine vm)

      • canPlaceVm

        boolean canPlaceVm(VirtualMachine vm,

        Returns true if the vm can be placed on the given host.
        Parameters:

        host -
        Returns:
        true if the vm can be placed on the given host

      • placeVm

        void placeVm(VirtualMachine vm,
           Host host)
        Takes all actions in order to place the given vm on the given host. When all actions were taken, the VM's parent is updated.
        You need to listen to the CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED to know when the placement has ended, as it may not be the case when this method returns.

        During the placement, any needed resources (example: VirtualRam and/or VirtualStorage) are instantiated and set accordingly to the vm's SLA constraints (as defined in its configuration).

        When the given vm already contains some or other resource, then implementations must use the already set resources and must not replace them.
        If the already set resources cannot comply to the SLA constraints, then an exception is thrown.

        The given host may be in another state than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON. If so then this method asks the cloud provider's power manger to power it on.

        You need to check for the return value of canPlaceVm(VirtualMachine, Host) to see if the vm can be placed on the given host.
        If you selected the host using selectHost(VirtualMachine) then this method should succeed.

        Parameters:
        vm - the VirtualMachine to place
        host - the Host where to place the vm
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the following condition(s) are true:
        • the vm has already a defined parent;
        • the vm has already some resources set, but some of them do not comply to SLA constraints;
        • the host cannot satisfy the vm SLA (it has not enough resources for that).

      • unplaceVm

        void unplaceVm(VirtualMachine vm)
        Takes all actions in order to unplaces the given vm.
        When all actions were taken, the VM's parent is updated (set to null).

        Any allocated resource during placement are detached from the parent host. This likely includes the VirtualRam and the VirtualStorage whose parents are then set to null.

        The parent host of the VM should be powered off if the cloud provider's power manger allows it to.

        Parameters:
        vm -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the VM was not placed using this entity
